Articles.Content: When i launching KSP i was stated that Mechjeb 2 and kspapiextensions is incompatible with 0.90, so i downloaded new ones and the message about Mechjeb is not shown but what is this kspapiextensions?

Youwould take a dll from there

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81496-0-25-KSPAPIExtensions-V1-7-1-Utilities-for-shared-mod-use

and better put it into GameData

As many mods include this dll in their distributives, first you have to find and delete all its existing instances in GameData.

No, no and no.

Don't delete or mix and match kspapiextensions version. Use the one shipped with your mods. And if you mods include an old version then wait for an update.

Don't delete .. And if you mods include an old version then wait for an update.

I.e. not use a mod at all instead of trying a chance (which in most cases successful).
I.e. don't use a mod rather than breaking your install and then coming to us with the broken install and saying your fault you brokeded it, fix it!

KSPAPIExtensions is not a mod. It is a library used by mods, and mods link to a very specific version of KSPAPIExtensions. Thus: do NOT download the dll yourself. Use only the dlls that come with your mods. If your mods have not updated, then you must wait.
